titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the New York University Archives Collection of the Education Sun RG.39.201
titlestmt.author: John Zarrillo

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-01-05 10:01:11 -0500.

did.unittitle: New York University Archives Collection of the Education Sun
did.abstract: This collection contains issues from the student newspaper the Education Sun, dating from 1931 to 1955. The paper was published by NYU School of Education students (later known as the Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development), and documented campus life, local and national news, athletics, and other student activities. The collection is extensive but not comprehensive, there may be some issues that were published but are not included in this collection. This collections includes issues in their original print format as well as microfilmed copies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains issues from the student newspaper the Education Sun, dating from 1931 to 1955. The paper was published by NYU School of Education students (later known as the Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development), and documented campus life, local and national news, athletics, and other student activities. The collection is extensive but not comprehensive, there may be some issues that were published but are not included in this collection. This collections includes issues in their original print format as well as microfilmed copies.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: New York University has had many student newspapers since its founding. The Education Sun was the student newspaper for the NYU School of Education (later known as the Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development) from 1931 through 1955.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials found in collection; there is no documentation concerning the provenance of these materials.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Researchers must consult microfilm copies due to the fragility of the original newspapers.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Published citations should take the following form: Identification of item, date; New York University Archives Collection of the Education Sun; RG 39.201; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University Libraries.

Student activities.
